texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: REVISED GUIDELINES ON CLASS AND WORK SUSPENSION IN SCHOOLS DURING DISASTERS AND EMERGENCIES
texts.text: REVISED GUIDELINES ON CLASS AND WORK SUSPENSION IN SCHOOLS DURING DISASTERS AND EMERGENCIES

texts.label: text
texts.orig: To: Undersecretaries Assistant Secretaries Bureau and Service Directors Minister , Basic, Higher and Technical Education, BARMM Regional Directors Schools Division Superintendents Public Elementary and Secondary Schools All Others Concerned
texts.text: To: Undersecretaries Assistant Secretaries Bureau and Service Directors Minister , Basic, Higher and Technical Education, BARMM Regional Directors Schools Division Superintendents Public Elementary and Secondary Schools All Others Concerned

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1 The Department of Education (DepEd) issues the enclosed Revised Guidelines on Class and Work Suspension in Schools During Disasters and Emergencies .
texts.text: 1 The Department of Education (DepEd) issues the enclosed Revised Guidelines on Class and Work Suspension in Schools During Disasters and Emergencies .

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. This Order outlines   guidelines for suspending   in-person classes   during disasters or emergencies: The goal is to safeguard learners, teachers, and nonteaching personnel from potential harm while ensuring uninterrupted learning.
texts.text: This Order outlines   guidelines for suspending   in-person classes   during disasters or emergencies: The goal is to safeguard learners, teachers, and nonteaching personnel from potential harm while ensuring uninterrupted learning.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3 Learners who miss learning activities due to class suspensions caused by disruptions such as disasters or emergencies resulting from natural or humaninduced hazards, shall be given due consideration regarding their attendance and the completion of their learning tasks.
texts.text: 3 Learners who miss learning activities due to class suspensions caused by disruptions such as disasters or emergencies resulting from natural or humaninduced hazards, shall be given due consideration regarding their attendance and the completion of their learning tasks.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4 All provisions of other existing issuances inconsistent with this Order are repealed, rescinded, or modified accordingly .
texts.text: 4 All provisions of other existing issuances inconsistent with this Order are repealed, rescinded, or modified accordingly .

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5. This Order shall take effect immediately after its publication on the DepEd website as well as its with the Office of the National Administrative Register (ONAR) at the University of the Philippines Law Center, UP Diliman, Quezon filing City .
texts.text: This Order shall take effect immediately after its publication on the DepEd website as well as its with the Office of the National Administrative Register (ONAR) at the University of the Philippines Law Center, UP Diliman, Quezon filing City .

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6 Immediate dissemination of and strict compliance with this Order is directed.
texts.text: 6 Immediate dissemination of and strict compliance with this Order is directed.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: GUIDELINES ON CLASS AND WORK SUSPENSION IN SCHOOLS DURING DISASTERS AND EMERGENCIES
texts.text: GUIDELINES ON CLASS AND WORK SUSPENSION IN SCHOOLS DURING DISASTERS AND EMERGENCIES

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: I RATIONALE
texts.text: I RATIONALE

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Department of  Education (DepEd)   upholds the principle of promoting the welfare, safety, and security of learners and personnel at all times. At the same time, it recognizes the importance of uninterrupted learning, even in times of disasters and calamities, especially for learners in disaster-prone areas. To balance these priorities, this policy emphasizes both the safety and academic continuity needed by learners and personnel.
texts.text: The Department of  Education (DepEd)   upholds the principle of promoting the welfare, safety, and security of learners and personnel at all times. At the same time, it recognizes the importance of uninterrupted learning, even in times of disasters and calamities, especially for learners in disaster-prone areas. To balance these priorities, this policy emphasizes both the safety and academic continuity needed by learners and personnel.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: In line with the existing policies of the Department in ensuring the welfare, safety, and security of our learners and school personnel, it also recognizes the need to adopt flexible measures in case of face-to-face class suspensions. Whenever feasible, schools shall shift to distance learning delivery modalities through online distance learning, modular distance learning, or blended learning to ensure learning continuity, in the event of face-to-face class suspensions.
texts.text: In line with the existing policies of the Department in ensuring the welfare, safety, and security of our learners and school personnel, it also recognizes the need to adopt flexible measures in case of face-to-face class suspensions. Whenever feasible, schools shall shift to distance learning delivery modalities through online distance learning, modular distance learning, or blended learning to ensure learning continuity, in the event of face-to-face class suspensions.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Thus, this Order outlines guidelines for suspending face-to-face classes during disasters or emergencies . The is to safeguard learners, teachers, and nonteaching personnel from potential harm while ensuring uninterrupted learning: goal
texts.text: Thus, this Order outlines guidelines for suspending face-to-face classes during disasters or emergencies . The is to safeguard learners, teachers, and nonteaching personnel from potential harm while ensuring uninterrupted learning: goal

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: II. SCOPE
texts.text: II. SCOPE

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The following guidelines require all public schools, and DepEd-operated Community Learning Centers under the Alternative Learning System (ALS), to strictly comply with the provisions of this Order.
texts.text: The following guidelines require all public schools, and DepEd-operated Community Learning Centers under the Alternative Learning System (ALS), to strictly comply with the provisions of this Order.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Private schools, private ALS providers, and basic education units of state /local universities and colleges (SUCs/LUCs) may opt to adopt the guidelines provided herein
texts.text: Private schools, private ALS providers, and basic education units of state /local universities and colleges (SUCs/LUCs) may opt to adopt the guidelines provided herein

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: III. POLICY STATEMENT
texts.text: III. POLICY STATEMENT

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The Department upholds the principle of promoting the welfare, safety, and security of learners and personnel at all times, which remains DepEds paramount consideration, while also ensuring continuity in learning.
texts.text: The Department upholds the principle of promoting the welfare, safety, and security of learners and personnel at all times, which remains DepEds paramount consideration, while also ensuring continuity in learning.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. This policy aims to protect the physical, psychosocial, and academic wellbeing of learners, personnel, and their families by providing guidance on the following:
texts.text: This policy aims to protect the physical, psychosocial, and academic wellbeing of learners, personnel, and their families by providing guidance on the following:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. Suspension of classes and work in schools during times of calamities, disasters and/or emergencies brought by natural or human induced hazards ,
texts.text: Suspension of classes and work in schools during times of calamities, disasters and/or emergencies brought by natural or human induced hazards ,

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: C. The roles and responsibilities of all concerned, highlighting the authority and responsibility of the Local Chief Executives (LCEs),
texts.text: The roles and responsibilities of all concerned, highlighting the authority and responsibility of the Local Chief Executives (LCEs),

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. Interventions needed to mitigate the impacts of face-to-face class suspensions caused by disasters and emergencies, ensuring that learners do not fall behind academically, and
texts.text: Interventions needed to mitigate the impacts of face-to-face class suspensions caused by disasters and emergencies, ensuring that learners do not fall behind academically, and

texts.label: text
texts.orig: schools division superintendents (SDS), and school heads in assessing and implementing appropriate suspension measures that best serve the safety and learning needs of their communities.
texts.text: schools division superintendents (SDS), and school heads in assessing and implementing appropriate suspension measures that best serve the safety and learning needs of their communities.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. This policy also acknowledges   that affected and vulnerable groups, including persons with disability and those with special needs are provided tailored in evacuation, recovery, and educational continuity during emergencies.
texts.text: This policy also acknowledges   that affected and vulnerable groups, including persons with disability and those with special needs are provided tailored in evacuation, recovery, and educational continuity during emergencies.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. This policy emphasizes that   personnel   required to provide   special services during emergencies must be promptly activated to perform necessary tasks to maintain essential operations. Once these duties are completed, personnel may return home to ensure their own safety. Special services rendered during emergencies shall be properly   compensated based on existing guidelines.
texts.text: This policy emphasizes that   personnel   required to provide   special services during emergencies must be promptly activated to perform necessary tasks to maintain essential operations. Once these duties are completed, personnel may return home to ensure their own safety. Special services rendered during emergencies shall be properly   compensated based on existing guidelines.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5. The following are possible reasons for the suspension of classes and/or work in schools:
texts.text: The following are possible reasons for the suspension of classes and/or work in schools:

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: a. Typhoons and Tropical Cyclones
texts.text: a. Typhoons and Tropical Cyclones

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The suspension of classes due to typhoons and tropical cyclones will follow PAGASA's Tropical Cyclone Wind Signals (TCWS) and Executive Order No. 66, S 2012.
texts.text: The suspension of classes due to typhoons and tropical cyclones will follow PAGASA's Tropical Cyclone Wind Signals (TCWS) and Executive Order No. 66, S 2012.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: If the TCWS is issued at a time when classes have already begun, the school shall immediately suspend the classes and work and send everyone home, if it is safe to do However, schools are obligated to the students and personnel safe in school if traveling has become unsafe. keep
texts.text: If the TCWS is issued at a time when classes have already begun, the school shall immediately suspend the classes and work and send everyone home, if it is safe to do However, schools are obligated to the students and personnel safe in school if traveling has become unsafe. keep

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: b. Heavy Rainfall and Flood
texts.text: b. Heavy Rainfall and Flood

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Suspension of classes for heavy rainfall will depend on the Rainfall Warning by the Philippine Atmospheric, Geophysical and Astronomical Services Administration (PAGASA).
texts.text: Suspension of classes for heavy rainfall will depend on the Rainfall Warning by the Philippine Atmospheric, Geophysical and Astronomical Services Administration (PAGASA).

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: C. Earthquakes
texts.text: C. Earthquakes

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Suspension of classes and work due to earthquakes will depend on the earthquake intensity as reported by the Philippine Institute of Volcanology and Seismology (PHIVOLCS) .
texts.text: Suspension of classes and work due to earthquakes will depend on the earthquake intensity as reported by the Philippine Institute of Volcanology and Seismology (PHIVOLCS) .

texts.label: text
texts.orig: If an earthquake of Intensity VI or higher occurs, the school head shall request from competent authorities   (Department of Public Works and Highways [DPWH], local building officials, division engineers, and other competent professionals) to assess the school buildings before allowing students and personnel to return.
texts.text: If an earthquake of Intensity VI or higher occurs, the school head shall request from competent authorities   (Department of Public Works and Highways [DPWH], local building officials, division engineers, and other competent professionals) to assess the school buildings before allowing students and personnel to return.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: d. Power Outages / Power Interruptions Brownouts
texts.text: d. Power Outages / Power Interruptions Brownouts

texts.label: text
texts.orig: There will be no automatic suspension of classes in the event that there are power outages, interruptions, or brownouts.
texts.text: There will be no automatic suspension of classes in the event that there are power outages, interruptions, or brownouts.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: e Extreme Heat Condition
texts.text: e Extreme Heat Condition

texts.label: text
texts.orig: There will be no automatic suspension of classes due to Extreme Heat Conditions. However, in case of unbearable heat, the LCE may still exercise its authority to facilitate localized class suspension based on the situation in their localities. The SDS shall coordinate with the LGUs for localized school suspensions, provided that schools will shift to modular distance learning, performance tasks, projects, or make-up classes to ensure that learning competencies are met.
texts.text: There will be no automatic suspension of classes due to Extreme Heat Conditions. However, in case of unbearable heat, the LCE may still exercise its authority to facilitate localized class suspension based on the situation in their localities. The SDS shall coordinate with the LGUs for localized school suspensions, provided that schools will shift to modular distance learning, performance tasks, projects, or make-up classes to ensure that learning competencies are met.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: f. Low Air Quality Vog (Volcanic Fog)
texts.text: f. Low Air Quality Vog (Volcanic Fog)

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Suspension of classes for Low Air Quality and Volcanic will depend on the Particle Matter 2.5 Air Quality Index as reported by the Environment Management Bureau (EMB) of the Department of Environment and Natural Resources (DENR) . Fog
texts.text: Suspension of classes for Low Air Quality and Volcanic will depend on the Particle Matter 2.5 Air Quality Index as reported by the Environment Management Bureau (EMB) of the Department of Environment and Natural Resources (DENR) . Fog

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: g. Other Emergencies and Hazards
texts.text: g. Other Emergencies and Hazards

texts.label: text
texts.orig: In cases of other calamities, emergencies, and hazards not enumerated above that may threaten the welfare and safety of learners and school personnel, the school heads, or the district or division ALS coordinator may suspend classes, and work as may be appropriate; provided that there is the necessary coordination with the LCE and SDS.
texts.text: In cases of other calamities, emergencies, and hazards not enumerated above that may threaten the welfare and safety of learners and school personnel, the school heads, or the district or division ALS coordinator may suspend classes, and work as may be appropriate; provided that there is the necessary coordination with the LCE and SDS.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: h. Localized/ Granular Suspensions
texts.text: h. Localized/ Granular Suspensions

texts.label: text
texts.orig: In case there is no automatic suspension of classes and in the absence of a declaration from the LGU, the school heads, or the district or division ALS coordinator, may suspend classes and work in the cases listed below, provided that there is the necessary coordination with the LCE and SDS, and when   applicable, schools will shift to modular distance learning, performance tasks, projects, or make-up classes based on their LSCP to ensure that learning competencies are met:
texts.text: In case there is no automatic suspension of classes and in the absence of a declaration from the LGU, the school heads, or the district or division ALS coordinator, may suspend classes and work in the cases listed below, provided that there is the necessary coordination with the LCE and SDS, and when   applicable, schools will shift to modular distance learning, performance tasks, projects, or make-up classes based on their LSCP to ensure that learning competencies are met:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: In case of torrential rain, flooding, and risk of landslides and storm surges;
texts.text: In case of torrential rain, flooding, and risk of landslides and storm surges;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: iii. In case of earthquake, at any intensity if in their assessment, the buildings and other structures within their facilities are deemed to be in danger of collapsing or are found to have major damage. The school head shall request from competent authorities (DPWH, local building officials, division engineers, and other  competent professionals) to assess the school buildings before allowing students and personnel to return;
texts.text: In case of earthquake, at any intensity if in their assessment, the buildings and other structures within their facilities are deemed to be in danger of collapsing or are found to have major damage. The school head shall request from competent authorities (DPWH, local building officials, division engineers, and other  competent professionals) to assess the school buildings before allowing students and personnel to return;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ii. ii. In case of localized and specific flooding in the area of the school premises; or when flooding affects a large part of the student and personnel population of the school;
texts.text: ii. In case of localized and specific flooding in the area of the school premises; or when flooding affects a large part of the student and personnel population of the school;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: iv . In case power outages or interruptions last more than half a school day, making classrooms uncomfortable or unsafe for students and teachers;
texts.text: iv . In case power outages or interruptions last more than half a school day, making classrooms uncomfortable or unsafe for students and teachers;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: vi. In case the air quality or vog levels in the area are poor and could harm students' health or hinder learning; and
texts.text: In case the air quality or vog levels in the area are poor and could harm students' health or hinder learning; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: V In case the temperature in classrooms or learning spaces is not conducive to learning and affects the health and safety of the learners and teachers;
texts.text: V In case the temperature in classrooms or learning spaces is not conducive to learning and affects the health and safety of the learners and teachers;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: vii. In case other calamities, emergencies, and hazards not enumerated above threaten the safety of students and school personnel.
texts.text: In case other calamities, emergencies, and hazards not enumerated above threaten the safety of students and school personnel.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: School heads shall immediately notify their   respective SDS of the suspension of classes and / or work, including the reason for such suspension. They shall also submit a report (Annex A) to the SDS through the School Governance and Operations Division (SGOD) on a quarterly basis.
texts.text: School heads shall immediately notify their   respective SDS of the suspension of classes and / or work, including the reason for such suspension. They shall also submit a report (Annex A) to the SDS through the School Governance and Operations Division (SGOD) on a quarterly basis.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 6. Adjustments to Learning Delivery Due to Suspension of Classes
texts.text: 6. Adjustments to Learning Delivery Due to Suspension of Classes

texts.label: text
texts.orig: In the event of suspended face-to-face classes, schools shall implement modular distance   learning, online distance learning, or blended learning, where feasible.
texts.text: In the event of suspended face-to-face classes, schools shall implement modular distance   learning, online distance learning, or blended learning, where feasible.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: In case of   suspension of face-to-face classes due to calamities and emergencies, and in areas where circumstances and resources permit, school heads have the discretion to choose any of the Alternative Delivery Modes (ADMs) below to support continued learning:
texts.text: In case of   suspension of face-to-face classes due to calamities and emergencies, and in areas where circumstances and resources permit, school heads have the discretion to choose any of the Alternative Delivery Modes (ADMs) below to support continued learning:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. Online Learning: If face-to-face classes are suspended but online access is available, online classes may continue. School
texts.text: Online Learning: If face-to-face classes are suspended but online access is available, online classes may continue. School

texts.label: text
texts.orig: heads may adjust class schedules to accommodate internet connectivity issues. Schools should also provide guidance on accessing digital resources.
texts.text: heads may adjust class schedules to accommodate internet connectivity issues. Schools should also provide guidance on accessing digital resources.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. Modular Learning: In case of suspension of face-to-face person classes or if online learning is not possible, school heads, in consultation with teachers, may arrange for modular learning. may select or develop alternative learning materials, such as but not limited modules, worksheets, or Learner Activity Sheets, and coordinate their distribution to ensure timely access for learners. They to,
texts.text: Modular Learning: In case of suspension of face-to-face person classes or if online learning is not possible, school heads, in consultation with teachers, may arrange for modular learning. may select or develop alternative learning materials, such as but not limited modules, worksheets, or Learner Activity Sheets, and coordinate their distribution to ensure timely access for learners. They to,

texts.label: text
texts.orig: School heads must inform their respective SDS if they decide to implement ADMs.
texts.text: School heads must inform their respective SDS if they decide to implement ADMs.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: In accordance with DepEd Order (DO) No. 014, s. 2021 (Guidelines on the Cancellation or Suspension of Classes and Work in Government Offices Due to Typhoons, Flooding, Other Weather Disturbances, and Calamities) , learners who miss learning activities due to class suspensions caused by disruptions such as disasters or emergencies resulting from natural or human-induced hazards, shall be given due consideration regarding their attendance and the completion of their learning tasks.
texts.text: In accordance with DepEd Order (DO) No. 014, s. 2021 (Guidelines on the Cancellation or Suspension of Classes and Work in Government Offices Due to Typhoons, Flooding, Other Weather Disturbances, and Calamities) , learners who miss learning activities due to class suspensions caused by disruptions such as disasters or emergencies resulting from natural or human-induced hazards, shall be given due consideration regarding their attendance and the completion of their learning tasks.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 7. Learning and Service Continuity Plan
texts.text: 7. Learning and Service Continuity Plan

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Schools must develop and update their LSCPs to prepare for class suspensions. LSCPs should include the following:
texts.text: Schools must develop and update their LSCPs to prepare for class suspensions. LSCPs should include the following:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. Identification of suitable ADMs for different types of disasters and emergencies, considering local circumstances. This ensures
texts.text: Identification of suitable ADMs for different types of disasters and emergencies, considering local circumstances. This ensures

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. Learning Resources to be utilized, including storage and access points, for necessary devices, equipment, and printed learning materials appropriate to the ADM being implemented, and how learners can access to these resources; gain
texts.text: Learning Resources to be utilized, including storage and access points, for necessary devices, equipment, and printed learning materials appropriate to the ADM being implemented, and how learners can access to these resources; gain

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: that learning continues even during disruptions;
texts.text: that learning continues even during disruptions;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: C. Storage and safekeeping procedures and protocol for school devices and equipment. In extraordinary circumstances where no space within the school premises is available to safely secure gadgets, devices, tools, and equipment, the school heads and personnel may move these items outside the school for safekeeping. However, must maintain an inventory of all school property transferred and ensure its return for reporting and record-keeping purposes. they
texts.text: Storage and safekeeping procedures and protocol for school devices and equipment. In extraordinary circumstances where no space within the school premises is available to safely secure gadgets, devices, tools, and equipment, the school heads and personnel may move these items outside the school for safekeeping. However, must maintain an inventory of all school property transferred and ensure its return for reporting and record-keeping purposes. they

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: e Technical Assistance Plan, for capacitating teachers on implementing ADMs through Learning Action Cells and other capability building interventions;
texts.text: e Technical Assistance Plan, for capacitating teachers on implementing ADMs through Learning Action Cells and other capability building interventions;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: d. Standard procedures for the mobilization of teachers, school heads, and school personnel in implementing ADMs during disasters and other emergency situations;
texts.text: Standard procedures for the mobilization of teachers, school heads, and school personnel in implementing ADMs during disasters and other emergency situations;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: f. The conduct of make-up classes and other learning recovery modes as necessary;
texts.text: The conduct of make-up classes and other learning recovery modes as necessary;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: g. Resource allocation, such as funding for relevant activities and resources, which shall be integrated into the School Improvement Plan (SIP);
texts.text: Resource allocation, such as funding for relevant activities and resources, which shall be integrated into the School Improvement Plan (SIP);

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: h. Community and Stakeholder Engagement to support the implementation of ADMs, and for resource generation;
texts.text: Community and Stakeholder Engagement to support the implementation of ADMs, and for resource generation;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: emergency situations, as deemed the local conditions.
texts.text: emergency situations, as deemed the local conditions.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: i. List of school-based services, and the types of alternative modes of implementation during specific types of disasters and other appropriate in the context of
texts.text: List of school-based services, and the types of alternative modes of implementation during specific types of disasters and other appropriate in the context of

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: j. Standard procedures for the mobilization of school heads, and school personnel in implementing school-based services during disasters and other emergency situations;
texts.text: Standard procedures for the mobilization of school heads, and school personnel in implementing school-based services during disasters and other emergency situations;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: personnel and learners,
texts.text: personnel and learners,

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: k. Return Plans which include protocols for the return of school
texts.text: Return Plans which include protocols for the return of school

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. Communication and contingency plans for safe shelter , and coordination among LGUs, schools, and parents; and
texts.text: Communication and contingency plans for safe shelter , and coordination among LGUs, schools, and parents; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: m LSCP .
texts.text: m LSCP .

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Timeline and process for assessment of the effectiveness of the
texts.text: Timeline and process for assessment of the effectiveness of the

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The LSCP aims to ensure their   processes and are pre-planned and ready to be implemented when disasters strike. This will enable schools to respond more quickly and effectively to that   ADMs, including resources, emergency situations by mobilizing learning resources.
texts.text: The LSCP aims to ensure their   processes and are pre-planned and ready to be implemented when disasters strike. This will enable schools to respond more quickly and effectively to that   ADMs, including resources, emergency situations by mobilizing learning resources.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The LSCP must be crafted every three years alongside the School and updated annually at the
texts.text: The LSCP must be crafted every three years alongside the School and updated annually at the

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Improvement Plan, but must be reviewed start of the school year. The process for the development of the LSCP is as follows:
texts.text: Improvement Plan, but must be reviewed start of the school year. The process for the development of the LSCP is as follows:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Risk analysis of potential disasters and emergency situations, including their historical frequency, probability, and potential effects on the school;
texts.text: Risk analysis of potential disasters and emergency situations, including their historical frequency, probability, and potential effects on the school;

texts.label: list_item

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Rehabilitation efforts after the disaster must align with DO 37 , 2015 (Comprehensive DRRM in the Basic Education Framework) and Republic Act No. 10121 (Philippine Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Act of 2010).
texts.text: Rehabilitation efforts after the disaster must align with DO 37 , 2015 (Comprehensive DRRM in the Basic Education Framework) and Republic Act No. 10121 (Philippine Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Act of 2010).

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Conduct of Make-up Classes
texts.text: Conduct of Make-up Classes

texts.label: text
texts.orig: When online or modular learning is not feasible, school heads, in consultation with teachers and parents/ guardians, may schedule makeup classes for all levels except Kindergarten to address missed competencies. These classes can be held during extended hours or on Saturdays to maximize learning recovery .
texts.text: When online or modular learning is not feasible, school heads, in consultation with teachers and parents/ guardians, may schedule makeup classes for all levels except Kindergarten to address missed competencies. These classes can be held during extended hours or on Saturdays to maximize learning recovery .

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Make-up classes will be required if the number of actual school considering class   suspensions and holidays, falls short of the 180 mandatory contact days as outlined in the school calendar. In exceptional circumstances where the school calendar is shortened, make-up classes will be required if the number of actual school days falls below 90% of the in the school calendar. Teachers who conduct make-up classes will receive  appropriate compensation, such as overtime pay or Vacation Service Credits (VSC), subject to existing policies. days, days
texts.text: Make-up classes will be required if the number of actual school considering class   suspensions and holidays, falls short of the 180 mandatory contact days as outlined in the school calendar. In exceptional circumstances where the school calendar is shortened, make-up classes will be required if the number of actual school days falls below 90% of the in the school calendar. Teachers who conduct make-up classes will receive  appropriate compensation, such as overtime pay or Vacation Service Credits (VSC), subject to existing policies. days, days

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 9 Maintenance of Workforce and Activation of DRRM Teams
texts.text: 9 Maintenance of Workforce and Activation of DRRM Teams

texts.label: text
texts.orig: When classes are suspended, teaching and non-teaching school personnel, including ALS teachers, shall not be required to report on-site, except those who are mandated to render security, safety, finance, engineering, sanitation, health, and disaster response duties. However, teachers may implement ADMs to support continued learning, subject to the provisions of Section III.6 of this Department Order.
texts.text: When classes are suspended, teaching and non-teaching school personnel, including ALS teachers, shall not be required to report on-site, except those who are mandated to render security, safety, finance, engineering, sanitation, health, and disaster response duties. However, teachers may implement ADMs to support continued learning, subject to the provisions of Section III.6 of this Department Order.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Schools must always be ready to facilitate remote work arrangements with clear performance measures, ensuring learning and service continuity.
texts.text: Schools must always be ready to facilitate remote work arrangements with clear performance measures, ensuring learning and service continuity.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Teachers and school-based personnel who render service in the school during work suspensions will be entitled to equivalent overtime pay, VSC, or overtime pay subject to existing guidelines.
texts.text: Teachers and school-based personnel who render service in the school during work suspensions will be entitled to equivalent overtime pay, VSC, or overtime pay subject to existing guidelines.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Central Office (CO), regional offices (ROs), SDOs, and schools shall activate their DRRM Teams to prepare, monitor , and respond to the situation. DRRM Team members, particularly DRRM coordinators and engineers shall be required to report to work in the aftermath of the disaster to continue undertaking response, early recovery, and reopening based on established DRRM   protocols (e.g., an inspection of school facilities to vet damages as reported by school DRRM coordinators; detailed assessment of damaged facilities for purposes of developing the Program of Works for infrastructure costing in rehabilitation and recovery plans, and participation in coordination meetings with LDRRMCs) . Other DRRM Team members may likewise be required to report to work; as needed.
texts.text: The Central Office (CO), regional offices (ROs), SDOs, and schools shall activate their DRRM Teams to prepare, monitor , and respond to the situation. DRRM Team members, particularly DRRM coordinators and engineers shall be required to report to work in the aftermath of the disaster to continue undertaking response, early recovery, and reopening based on established DRRM   protocols (e.g., an inspection of school facilities to vet damages as reported by school DRRM coordinators; detailed assessment of damaged facilities for purposes of developing the Program of Works for infrastructure costing in rehabilitation and recovery plans, and participation in coordination meetings with LDRRMCs) . Other DRRM Team members may likewise be required to report to work; as needed.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 10. Use of schools as Evacuation Center or Quarantine and/or Isolation Facility /Vaccination Center
texts.text: 10. Use of schools as Evacuation Center or Quarantine and/or Isolation Facility /Vaccination Center

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Schools shall not be used as quarantine and/or isolation facilities or vaccination centers Mobile vaccinations of not more than two that do not disrupt classes or school co-curricular activities may be allowed. days
texts.text: Schools shall not be used as quarantine and/or isolation facilities or vaccination centers Mobile vaccinations of not more than two that do not disrupt classes or school co-curricular activities may be allowed. days

texts.label: text
texts.orig: In case of other disasters, schools may be used as an immediate evacuation site which should not last for more than 15 days. LGUs cannot use schools as long-term shelters for evacuees.
texts.text: In case of other disasters, schools may be used as an immediate evacuation site which should not last for more than 15 days. LGUs cannot use schools as long-term shelters for evacuees.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 1l. Conduct of Psychological First Aid
texts.text: 1l. Conduct of Psychological First Aid

texts.label: text
texts.orig: As the maintenance of a conducive   learning environment   requires addressing the immediate needs of affected learners and personnel in the aftermath of disasters, all SDOs, with the support of ROs, through the expertise of trained and specialized individuals shall assess the Mental Health and Psychosocial Support needs and services and lead the conduct of Psychological First Aid (PFA) . This shall include the mobilization of trained PFA providers and partners, and if needed, referral pathways for learners and personnel identified for further   specialized psychological support services. Required health standards shall be always applied.
texts.text: As the maintenance of a conducive   learning environment   requires addressing the immediate needs of affected learners and personnel in the aftermath of disasters, all SDOs, with the support of ROs, through the expertise of trained and specialized individuals shall assess the Mental Health and Psychosocial Support needs and services and lead the conduct of Psychological First Aid (PFA) . This shall include the mobilization of trained PFA providers and partners, and if needed, referral pathways for learners and personnel identified for further   specialized psychological support services. Required health standards shall be always applied.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: IV. ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
texts.text: IV. ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

texts.label: text
texts.orig: School heads shall immediately notify their respective SDS of the suspension of classes and/or work, providing the reason for such suspension. shall then select   appropriate ADMs to ensure continued learning, report the implemented ADMs, coordinate with teachers for scheduling make-up classes, and collect and report data on the effectiveness of the ADMs. They
texts.text: School heads shall immediately notify their respective SDS of the suspension of classes and/or work, providing the reason for such suspension. shall then select   appropriate ADMs to ensure continued learning, report the implemented ADMs, coordinate with teachers for scheduling make-up classes, and collect and report data on the effectiveness of the ADMs. They

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The SDS shall review and approve school LSCPs, coordinate with LGUs on localized school suspensions; and submit consolidated reports on the use of ADMs in schools to the RO and CO
texts.text: The SDS shall review and approve school LSCPs, coordinate with LGUs on localized school suspensions; and submit consolidated reports on the use of ADMs in schools to the RO and CO

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The RO shall consolidate reports from SDOs on the use of ADMs in schools and submit them to the CO.
texts.text: The RO shall consolidate reports from SDOs on the use of ADMs in schools and submit them to the CO.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The DRRMS , in coordination with relevant DepEd CO units and affected regions and divisions, will continue to lead the implementation of existing mechanisms for monitoring, reporting, and responding to the impacts of disasters on DepEd schools. This includes the suspension of classes and work, the activation of DRRM Teams, and the delivery of PFA.
texts.text: The DRRMS , in coordination with relevant DepEd CO units and affected regions and divisions, will continue to lead the implementation of existing mechanisms for monitoring, reporting, and responding to the impacts of disasters on DepEd schools. This includes the suspension of classes and work, the activation of DRRM Teams, and the delivery of PFA.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Bureau of Learning Delivery (BLD) under the Curriculum and Instruction Strand shall continue leading the monitoring, reporting, and response to needed adjustments to learning delivery strategies due to suspensions.
texts.text: The Bureau of Learning Delivery (BLD) under the Curriculum and Instruction Strand shall continue leading the monitoring, reporting, and response to needed adjustments to learning delivery strategies due to suspensions.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Bureau of Learning Resources must prioritize and promptly distribute resource allocations for  learning resources needed for BLDMs, ADMs, and education recovery.
texts.text: The Bureau of Learning Resources must prioritize and promptly distribute resource allocations for  learning resources needed for BLDMs, ADMs, and education recovery.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Parents or guardians have the ultimate responsibility for determining whether their children should attend classes in consideration of their physical and/or mental health during disasters and calamities. This even if no order for suspension of classes has been issued. applies
texts.text: Parents or guardians have the ultimate responsibility for determining whether their children should attend classes in consideration of their physical and/or mental health during disasters and calamities. This even if no order for suspension of classes has been issued. applies

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Nonetheless, it shall also be the responsibility of the parents or guardians to ensure that their child is able to catch up with the needed competencies that the learners should master.
texts.text: Nonetheless, it shall also be the responsibility of the parents or guardians to ensure that their child is able to catch up with the needed competencies that the learners should master.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: V REPORTING
texts.text: V REPORTING

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Schools must, on a quarterly basis, report the types of class suspensions, the circumstances therein, and ADMs utilized during class suspensions. For schools
texts.text: Schools must, on a quarterly basis, report the types of class suspensions, the circumstances therein, and ADMs utilized during class suspensions. For schools

texts.label: text
texts.orig: wherein teachers were not required to report to school during class suspensions; teachers shall report the type of ADM implemented, as part of the quarterly reporting of the school.
texts.text: wherein teachers were not required to report to school during class suspensions; teachers shall report the type of ADM implemented, as part of the quarterly reporting of the school.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Schools must   prepare their LSCP alongside their SIP . Draft LSCPs must be submitted to the School Governance and Operations Division (SGOD) and Curriculum Implementation Division (CID) chiefs for review, and then endorsed to the SDS for final approval. The template for the LSCP is attached as Annex B Schools shall also review and update it annually at the start of the school year, to consider changes in context; staffing, physical spaces, and availability of learning resources and equipment. The SGOD and CID chiefs, and the SDS shall be provided with a copy of annual updates to facilitate monitoring and review as necessary.
texts.text: Schools must   prepare their LSCP alongside their SIP . Draft LSCPs must be submitted to the School Governance and Operations Division (SGOD) and Curriculum Implementation Division (CID) chiefs for review, and then endorsed to the SDS for final approval. The template for the LSCP is attached as Annex B Schools shall also review and update it annually at the start of the school year, to consider changes in context; staffing, physical spaces, and availability of learning resources and equipment. The SGOD and CID chiefs, and the SDS shall be provided with a copy of annual updates to facilitate monitoring and review as necessary.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The schools and governance levels must abide by the Coordination and Information Management Protocols relative to DRRM implementation as stated in DO 21, s. 2015 or the Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Coordination and Information Management Protocol.
texts.text: The schools and governance levels must abide by the Coordination and Information Management Protocols relative to DRRM implementation as stated in DO 21, s. 2015 or the Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Coordination and Information Management Protocol.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: VI. MONITORING AND EVALUATION
texts.text: VI. MONITORING AND EVALUATION

texts.label: text
texts.orig: As part of the response operations during and in the aftermath of a disaster and/or emergency, the DRRMS monitors the suspension and resumption of classes which is being reported by the affected division offices. The reports on class suspension and resumption form part of the situation report and education cluster updates that the DRRMS submits to the  DepEd Executive Committee, Management   Committee, affected field offices, National Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Council (NDRRMC) , and partners.
texts.text: As part of the response operations during and in the aftermath of a disaster and/or emergency, the DRRMS monitors the suspension and resumption of classes which is being reported by the affected division offices. The reports on class suspension and resumption form part of the situation report and education cluster updates that the DRRMS submits to the  DepEd Executive Committee, Management   Committee, affected field offices, National Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Council (NDRRMC) , and partners.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The BLD shall regularly monitor the effectiveness of ADMs during disasters by consolidating; verifying, and analyzing reports from the regions. These reports will highlight challenges, learner participation rates, and resource utilization.
texts.text: The BLD shall regularly monitor the effectiveness of ADMs during disasters by consolidating; verifying, and analyzing reports from the regions. These reports will highlight challenges, learner participation rates, and resource utilization.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The SDOs must establish a structured feedback system to assess the impact of class suspensions on students'   learning progress. This feedback can inform necessary adjustments to learning delivery strategies. should also collect data on challenges, learner participation, resource utilization, and class suspension /resumption details for BLDMs and ADMs. This information will be reported to the RO They
texts.text: The SDOs must establish a structured feedback system to assess the impact of class suspensions on students'   learning progress. This feedback can inform necessary adjustments to learning delivery strategies. should also collect data on challenges, learner participation, resource utilization, and class suspension /resumption details for BLDMs and ADMs. This information will be reported to the RO They

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: VII. REPEALING CLAUSE
texts.text: VII. REPEALING CLAUSE

texts.label: text
texts.orig: All DepEd Orders, memoranda, and other related issuances, rules, regulations, and provisions, which are inconsistent with these guidelines are repealed, rescinded, or modified accordingly.
texts.text: All DepEd Orders, memoranda, and other related issuances, rules, regulations, and provisions, which are inconsistent with these guidelines are repealed, rescinded, or modified accordingly.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: VIII. EFFECTIVITY
texts.text: VIII. EFFECTIVITY

texts.label: text
texts.orig: This Order shall take effect immediately after its publication on the DepEd Website as well as its with the Office of the National Administrative Registrar (ONAR) at the University of the Philippines Law Center, UP Diliman, Quezon City . filing
texts.text: This Order shall take effect immediately after its publication on the DepEd Website as well as its with the Office of the National Administrative Registrar (ONAR) at the University of the Philippines Law Center, UP Diliman, Quezon City . filing

table_cells.text: Classes for Kindergarten in the affected area shall be automatically suspended

Face to face Classes for Kindergarten and Elementary to Junior High School (JHS) or Grade 10 in the affected area shall be automatically suspended; provided that Elementary and JHS will shift to modular distance learning, performance tasks, projects, or make-up classes based on their Learning and Service Continuity Plan (LSCP) to that learning competencies are met.
Classes and work in all levels in the affected area shall be automatically suspended.

grid.text: Classes for Kindergarten in the affected area shall be automatically suspended

Classes and work in all levels in the affected area shall be automatically suspended.

table_cells.text: For areas in the province / city /municipality with torrential rains/ flooding and based on the assessment of the school, the learners and personnel are still exposed to various risks, the SDS shall coordinate with the local government unit (LGU) for localized school suspensions. The LCE shall decide on the suspension of face to face classes, and work in schools, provided that schools will shift to modular distance learning, performance tasks, projects, or make-up classes based on their LSCP to ensure that learning competencies are met.
Orange or Red Warning (Rainfall) and Critical Water Level (Flooding) at a time when classes have already begun for the day
